definition: to feel/to move/to touch/to affect/feeling/emotion/(suffix) sense of ~
see 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]
festival/holiday/node/joint/section/segment/part/to economize/to save/to abridge/moral integrity/classifier for segments, e.g. lessons, train wagons, biblical verses/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Her selection is still to be formalized and will not be announced until after Thanksgiving.
sentences.chinese: 在感恩节结束之前，希拉里不会正式宣布其决定。

sentences.english: The "First Thanksgiving" in 1621 was actually a harvest festival.
sentences.chinese: 第一次感恩节发生在1621年，为了庆祝农业丰收。

sentences.english: Now I would like to give you some details every second of-around Thyourksgiving Day in the United Sthlistings.
sentences.chinese: 现在我想给你们详明谈谈美国的感恩节。

sentences.english: The broadening views of family are expected to have an impact at Thanksgiving.
sentences.chinese: 放宽了的家庭观念估计会对感恩节产生影响。

sentences.english: A：I took my little sister to see the Thanksgiving Day parade before dinner.
sentences.chinese: 晚饭前我带我的小妹去看了感恩节游行。

sentences.english: Except for Thanksgiving turkey, it's hard to find a typically "American" food. The United States is a land of immigrants.
sentences.chinese: 除了感恩节火鸡以外，挺难找到典型的美国食物。

sentences.english: Many people eat more at Thanksgiving than at any other time of the year.
sentences.chinese: 很多人在感恩节这天吃的比年里任何时候都多。

sentences.english: I will be home for Thanksgiving so save a little turkey for me.
sentences.chinese: 我会回家过感恩节，请留点儿火鸡给我。

sentences.english: The main dishes for Thanksgiving Day are turkey and pumpkin pie.
sentences.chinese: 感恩节家宴上的主菜是火鸡和南瓜馅饼。

sentences.english: I busied myself with shopping, then turned my attention to our Thanksgiving table.
sentences.chinese: 我忙着购物，然后一门心思都扑到感恩节大餐上。

sentences.english: She and the Molinas are going to spend Thanksgiving with their cousins.
sentences.chinese: 她和Molinas一家人准备与亲戚一起过感恩节。

sentences.english: So how did turkey get to be the Thanksgiving bird?
sentences.chinese: 那么火鸡怎么成为了感恩节的吉祥物呢？

sentences.english: These too, can stay up through Thanksgiving.
sentences.chinese: 这些葫芦可以放置到感恩节之后。

sentences.english: this is the first in a long line of thanksgivings to come.
sentences.chinese: 这是将来无数感恩节的第一个。

sentences.english: Thanks-giving Day is observed as a general holiday by the American people.
sentences.chinese: 美国人普遍将感恩节作为节日来庆祝。

sentences.english: You always make such a big deal out of thanksgiving?
sentences.chinese: 你总是为感恩节这样大费周张吗？

definition: Hanukkah (Chanukah), 8 day Jewish holiday starting on the 25th day of Kislev (can occur from late Nov up to late Dec on Gregorian calendar)/also called 哈努卡節|哈努卡节 and simply 哈努卡
Teachers' Day (September 10th in PRC and Confucius's birthday, September 28th in Taiwan)
the Mid-Autumn Festival on 15th of 8th lunar month
Double Ninth or Yang Festival/9th day of 9th lunar month
